Description: Rough straw-tempered Nile silt pottery vase with ovoid body, rounded base, flaring neck and everted rolled rim (chipped in places); the body shows signs of having been hand-shaped from different segments (mould-made base, coiled body, separate neck). Slightly deformed at side of body. Coated with self slip.
Curator's comments: Rough ware R92 in in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
